titles.title: Fair FSAs Act of 2020
Fair FSAs Act of 2020
A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to require employers to cash out the flexible spending accounts of employees who separate from employment, and for other purposes.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

term.name: Emergency medical services and trauma care

bill.summary:
Fair FSAs Act of 2020
This bill requires employers to allow employees who separate from employment to elect to receive a distribution from their health flexible spending arrangement. It also allows employees to roll over existing balances attributable to a reduction in expected elective health care expenses in the plan year due to the outbreak of COVID-19 (i.e., coronavirus disease 2019).
